p:
Ethanol has been reported to be suitable for extraction of compounds with a wide range of polarity while water is suitable for very polar compounds
30 . Consequently, a higher quantity of phenolic compounds, proanthocyanidin and flavonoids were observed in the ethanol samples when compared to the acetone, blanched and aqueous extracts; hence, better activity. This is in agreement with previous reports that ethanol is more suitable for the extraction of phenolic compounds in plants
30â€“ 32 . Furthermore, high phenolic compounds were indicated in ethyl acetate and methanol extracts, suggesting the reason for its high antioxidant activity
13 . Flavonoid content of acetone extract of H. arborescens was comparable to results obtained by Elisha et al.
13 ; however, total phenolic content was much higher as opposed to the current study.
